text: uhm it should work, but normally we keep the code in one place, as we don’t put too much logic on serverless functions anyway
but I’ll give it a try out of curiosity

Hey, all. Anyone aware of whether it’s possible to force a re-render of the CRM Card? We’re trying to have a card act as somewhat of a flow, but the only way we can do that as of now is to have the user refresh the page after interacting with the card to see the next step. I’ve looked into it for a bit now, and the functionality appears to not exist, but I figured I’d give it one last try here! :sweat_smile:

Best to put this in the <#C04A3FUK8HK|crm-development-beta> but currently it's not possible to force a refresh of the card without user interaction, this interaction could look like a button called refresh and then user could trigger the serverless function to send a new state to the card. keep in mind this will not update any 'form' components per this thread in the community <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CRM-Development-Tools-Beta/Section-content-refresh-after-serverless-function-hook/td-p/715598> <@U03FJQPSC0Y> with hopefully have an update for us later this month

Thanks. This is helpful. So we are able to update state via a serverless function? I’ve attempted running sendResponse with a new “sections” array, but that hasn’t appeared to impact state at all, so I’m not sure how. Maybe I’m misunderstanding? Either way, I appreciate the response!
